questions.question: 1) An 8-pole, 3-phase, 50 Hz induction motor is operating at a speed of 720 rpm. The frequency of the rotor current of the motor in Hz is __________

explanations.a: The rotor frequency is calculated as 2 Hz using slip and synchronous speed relation.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Rotor frequency is not 4 Hz. The correct value is 2 Hz.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The correct rotor frequency is 2 Hz, not 3 Hz.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The rotor frequency is 2 Hz, not 1 Hz.

questions.question: 2) The frame of an induction motor is made of ______

explanations.a: Aluminium is light and corrosion-resistant but not commonly used for induction motor frames due to strength limitations.
explanations.b: Silicon steel is used for motor laminations, not the frame, as it enhances magnetic properties but lacks structural strength.
explanations.c: Cast iron is commonly used for motor frames due to its strength, durability, and ability to dissipate heat effectively.
explanations.d: Stainless steel is corrosion-resistant but is typically too expensive and heavy for use in motor frames.

questions.question: 3) Slip ring of an induction motor is usually made up of

explanations.a: Aluminium is light but lacks the necessary wear resistance and strength for slip rings.
explanations.b: Copper is a good conductor but not as durable as phosphorus bronze for slip rings.
explanations.c: Phosphorus bronze is corrosion-resistant, durable, and offers wear resistance, making it ideal for slip rings.
explanations.d: Carbon is used in motor brushes, not typically for constructing slip rings.

answers.d: Two rotors moving in opposite direction

explanations.a: A double squirrel-cage motor does not have two series windings in the stator.
explanations.b: The stator does not have two parallel windings in a double squirrel-cage induction motor.
explanations.c: The rotor has two cages: one outer with low reactance and one inner with high reactance.
explanations.d: A double squirrel-cage motor uses a single rotor, not two rotors moving in opposite directions.
